title: Tuna with Warm Cucumber and Fennel Salad
summary: Tuna with Warm Cucumber and Fennel Salad is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. This recipe serves 4. For $6.33 per serving, this recipe covers 33% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 378 calories, 41g of protein, and 23g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. A mixture of parsley, olive oil, salt, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 90%, this dish is awesome. Try Warm Wheat Berries with Tuna, Fennel and Olives, Warm Endive & Fennel Salad, and Warm Potato Salad With Bacon And Fennel for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. One wine you could try is GEN5 Merlot. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 12 dollars.

instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Brush 2 tbsp of the oil over the tuna steaks. Season with salt and a generous amount of pepper. Refrigerate until ready to cook.                                                     Heat 2 tbsp of the remaining oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the fennel and cook, stirring often, about 4 minutes, just until crisp-tender. Transfer to a bowl and let cool.                                                     Add the cucumber, shallots, lemon juice, remaining 2 tbsp oil, and the herbs to the fennel and mix. Season with salt and pepper.                                                     Heat a large frying pan over high heat until very hot. Add the tuna and cook, turning once, about 1 minute per side, until seared.                                                     Transfer each tuna steak to a dinner plate. Using a slotted spoon, serve the salad on top, and drape 2 anchovies over each serving. Garnish each with a lemon wedge. Spoon the dressing around the tuna and serve immediately.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Brush 2 tbsp of the oil over the tuna steaks. Season with salt and a generous amount of pepper. Refrigerate until ready to cook.
Heat 2 tbsp of the remaining oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add the fennel and cook, stirring often, about 4 minutes, just until crisp-tender.
Transfer to a bowl and let cool.
Add the cucumber, shallots, lemon juice, remaining 2 tbsp oil, and the herbs to the fennel and mix. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat a large frying pan over high heat until very hot.
Add the tuna and cook, turning once, about 1 minute per side, until seared.
Transfer each tuna steak to a dinner plate. Using a slotted spoon, serve the salad on top, and drape 2 anchovies over each serving.
Garnish each with a lemon wedge. Spoon the dressing around the tuna and serve immediately.
